glsa.title: Multiple Ralink wireless drivers: Execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: An integer overflow in multiple Ralink wireless drivers might lead to the execution of arbitrary code with elevated privileges.

description.p: Aviv reported an integer overflow in multiple Ralink wireless card drivers when processing a probe request packet with a long SSID, possibly related to an integer signedness error.

impact.p: A physically proximate attacker could send specially crafted packets to a user who has wireless networking enabled, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with root privileges.

resolution.p: All external kernel modules have been masked and we recommend that users unmerge those drivers. The Linux mainline kernel has equivalent support for these devices and the vulnerability has been resolved in stable versions of sys-kernel/gentoo-sources.
